snippet: Not meddling with nature is central to America’s modern wilderness tradition, but should we make an exception to save a population of wolves from extinction?
abstract: Op-Ed article by wildlife and environmental experts John A Vucetich, Rolf O Peterson and Michael P Nelson on National Park Service decision on whether to save wolf population in Isle Royale National Park; holds not meddling with nature is central to America's modern wilderness tradition but urges agency to introduce new wolves to island to keep population of moose in check.

byline.original: By JOHN A. VUCETICH, MICHAEL P. NELSON and ROLF O. PETERSON

lead_paragraph: Not meddling with nature is central to America’s modern wilderness tradition, but should we make an exception to save a population of wolves from extinction?

headline.seo: Save the Wolves of Isle Royale National Park
headline.main: Predator and Prey, a Delicate Dance
headline.print_headline: Predator and Prey, a Delicate Dance
